column4: guys, i've made an image of my 40gb hd containing my so (using dd), now i want to put that image on another bigger hd (ie 80gb), how can i do that?
Same way you did it before.
ehm, i just made the image of my hd, now i want to put that image on another hd... how can it work the same way?
It will end up as a smaller partition, but you can use gprted to enlarge it.  Or you can use g4u  See: http://www.feyrer.de/g4u/
sorry i still don't get it, what's the command to put the file.img in the hd?
dd if=file.img of=/dev/sda  #Where sda is the HD you really want to put it on. That will take a wile tho.  There are ways to speed it up. See:  man dd
btw is there a way to see shares by command line?
Ok good.  I was thinking if it were nfs you'd find them in /etc/exports
the shares are from another server
Just guessing.  Don't know how you have them mounted.
Do you see them in the output of mount ?
